sentence: U.S. stock futures were hovering around nearly unchanged, with S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average down 0.05% and 0.06%, respectively while the Nasdaq was up 0.10% ahead of GDP and jobless data.
Out at 8:30 a.m. E.T, real gross domestic product is expected to have risen 2.9% in Q2 compared to a 0.2% contraction in Q1.
The consensus range is between a 1.9% and a 3.5% increase, according to data compiled by Econoday.
Meanwhile, jobless claims in the week to July 25 are expected to have risen to 272,000 from 255,000 in the previous week.
The consensus range is between 270,000 and 275,000.
In equities, Facebook ( FB ) was the most actively traded before the market opened, trading down 2.2% after reporting late Wednesday that its Q2 earnings fell on higher costs.
Consumer products giant Procter & Gamble ( PG ) was also lower 2.7% after reporting weaker-than-expected Q2 earnings.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
